nodes.bodyText: Thank you for the PR! Can you add this in python-experimental also?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -133,7 +133,7 @@ class RESTClientObject(object):
 
         timeout = None
         if _request_timeout:
-            if isinstance(_request_timeout, (int, ) if six.PY3 else (int, long)):  # noqa: E501,F821

nodes.bodyText: Good catch! I missed that we had a python-experimental package - is this package intended to solely generate Python3.x compatible code?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -133,7 +133,7 @@ class RESTClientObject(object):
 
         timeout = None
         if _request_timeout:
-            if isinstance(_request_timeout, (int, ) if six.PY3 else (int, long)):  # noqa: E501,F821

nodes.bodyText:
Python-experimental has better feature coverage
it includes:

additionalProperties support
data types are defined with classes not strings
type checking is done when sending to endpoints, receiving from them, and instantiating models
composed schemas are fully supported
python 2 has been removed, it uses python 3.5 or higher
library load time has been sped up in python-experimental vs python
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -133,7 +133,7 @@ class RESTClientObject(object):
 
         timeout = None
         if _request_timeout:
-            if isinstance(_request_timeout, (int, ) if six.PY3 else (int, long)):  # noqa: E501,F821

nodes.bodyText: Gotcha - thanks for clarifying that. I noticed it appeared to only use Python3.x supported syntax, so I went ahead and followed suit. Glad to hear that was the right move!
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -133,7 +133,7 @@ class RESTClientObject(object):
 
         timeout = None
         if _request_timeout:
-            if isinstance(_request_timeout, (int, ) if six.PY3 else (int, long)):  # noqa: E501,F821

nodes.bodyText:
These files should not change because your update is for python only.
Can you run:
mvn clean install
then run
bin/utils/ensure-up-to-date
That should remove these updates and will use your mustache changes to generate new python sample files.

I thought it was a little odd that these non-python files ended up having their content modified, but they were generated as a side-effect of running ./bin/generate-samples.sh as requested in the PR template - possibly because I ran it unscoped? I'll retry using the following:
$ mvn clean install
$ ./bin/generate-samples.sh bin/configs/python*
$ ./bin/utils/ensure-up-to-date
Yup, you can even leave off running ensure up to date. Generate samples does what we need. If others are needed ci will error out.
No change resulted from the above - I'll revert c6df281 and regenerate samples that are python-specific instead.

Magic incantation appears to have been:
$ mvn clean install
$ ./bin/generate-samples.sh bin/configs/python*
Calling ./bin/utils/ensure-up-to-date brings back the unwanted diff:

18 files changed, 125 insertions(+), 125 deletions(-)
